name: Goat Cheese Stuffed Date Salad
author: Carissa Vogel
summary: This is a quick, light salad that is very satisfying. Great for one person or a large group. I used this for myself one night for dinner, but the recipe can be made for any number of people. I also didn't think to put pecans on the salad at the time, but I'm sure it would make a great addition to it.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons honey-flavored goat cheese, or as needed
¼ cup grape tomatoes, or to taste
directions: Preheat grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate
Spread goat cheese inside each date half
Cook dates on preheated grill until dates begin to caramelize and goat cheese melts, about 5 minutes
Remove from grill and cut each date half into halves
Mix spinach, pear, onion, and tomatoes together on a plate or in a bowl; top with dates
Drizzle olive oil and vinegar over salad
